apps.description: Browse, inspect, and manipulate your Apps

site.name: site
site.description: use a specific quip site rather than the standard quip.com login

id.name: id
id.description: show the details of an app ID

version.name: version
version.description: which version to show the details for. Only useful with --id

bump.description: Bump the application version (and create a version commit/tag)

message.name: message
message.description: Specify a commit message to use as the version commit message

version-number.name: version-number
version-number.description: Bump the version to a specific number rather than just incrementing to the next integer

prerelease-name.name: prerelease-name
prerelease-name.description: When specifying prerelease, use this as the prefix, e.g. -p alpha will produce v0.x.x-alpha.x

no-git.name: no-git
no-git.description: Don't perform git operations even when available (just makes changes inline)

args.name: increment
args.description: which number to bump - can be one of 'prerelease', 'major', 'minor', 'patch', or 'none' - defaults to 'none'

init.description: Initialize a new Live App Project

dry-run.name: dry-run
dry-run.description: Print what this would do, but don't create any files.

no-create.name: no-create
no-create.description: only create a local app (don't create an app in the dev console or assign an ID)

no-release.name: no-release
no-release.description: don't release the initial version (leave app uninstallable and in the "unreleased" state)

dir.name: dir
dir.description: specify directory to create app in (defaults to the name provided)

site.name: site
site.description: use a specific quip site rather than the standard quip.com login

json.name: json
json.description: output responses in JSON (must provide --name and --id)

name.name: name
name.description: set the name of the application

id.name: id
id.description: set the ID of the application

login.description: Logs in to Quip and stores credentials in the .quiprc file

force.name: force
force.description: forces a re-login even if a user is currently logged in

site.name: site
site.description: use a specific quip site rather than the standard quip.com login

port.name: port
port.description: Use a custom port for the OAuth redirect server (defaults to 9898)

hostname.name: hostname
hostname.description: Use a custom hostname for the OAuth redirect server (defaults to 127.0.0.1)

folder.name: folder
folder.description: The folder where your migrations are stored

version.name: version
version.description: The version to generate this migration for. By default, it will use the current version_number in the manifest

dry-run.name: dry-run
dry-run.description: Print what this would do, but don't create any files.

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: A manifest.json file to add the migration to. By default, we'll use the first one we find.

args.name: name
args.description: A short description to generate the filename with

publish.description: Uploads this bundle to the developer console, and sets it as the latest development version.

site.name: site
site.description: use a specific quip site rather than the standard quip.com login

release.description: Release an app to Beta or Production

site.name: site
site.description: use a specific quip site rather than the standard quip.com login

major-changes.name: major-changes
major-changes.description: First party only: required when using --prod. Pass either YES or NO to indicate if this build contains major security, availability, or confidentiality changes
